Progress is being made in identifying and interpreting physiological signals in patients who may progress to shock syndrome. A low echocardiographic stroke volume index and reduced left ventricular function plus high admission venous lactate levels identified dengue patients at high risk of recurrent shock and respiratory distress
56 . In 2000, age of 5 to 15 years, a history of vomiting, higher temperature, a palpable liver, and a lower platelet count were risk factors for dengue shock while, during illness, absolute values and rate of daily decline of platelet counts successfully predicted shock
57 .
